section.name: Website Development
section.span: Publish your Hippo CMS managed content on the web.
section.p: Publishing content on the web is the most common use case for Hippo CMS. To integrate Hippo CMS in your new or existing web site, intranet or extranet, you can use the tools provided by Hippo that utilize the standard JCR interface, and the extendable architecture of Hippo CMS.

This section directs you to the right tools for your situation, and explains how to customize Hippo CMS by creating your own add-ons. In addition, it tells you how to get direct access to the repository content through the JCR interface.

ul.li: Toolkits - Using one of the available toolkits is the recommended way to implement Hippo CMS. The toolkits help you create websites and portals using the technology of your choice.
Add-ons - Extend Hippo CMS with your own add-ons.
JCR Interface - Access your content through the standard JCR interface. This will give you direct access and offers almost unlimited possibilities.
